org.myrobotlab.reflection
Class Instantiator

java.lang.Object
  org.myrobotlab.reflection.Instantiator

public class Instantiator
extends java.lang.Object

Class to help make life easier when instantiating objects using the String name of the class along with an optional array of constructor parameters.

Author:
SwedaKonsult

getPrimitive

public static java.lang.Object getPrimitive(java.lang.Class<?> cls)
Return an empty/default boxed primitive. This is somewhat heavy since it creates a boxed instance of the primitive.

Parameters:
cls -
Returns:

invokeMethod

public static <T> T invokeMethod(java.lang.Object object,
                                 java.lang.String method,
                                 java.lang.Object... params)
Invoke in the context of this Service. It is suggested to use one of the primitive overload methods when the expected result is a primitive. This is for 2 reasons: (1) the primitive will be boxed in this case which means more overhead (2) if something fails a NULL is returned which results in an exception on the calling end

Parameters:
method -
params -
Returns:
null if anything fails
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the expected return type is a primitive

isPrimitive

public static boolean isPrimitive(java.lang.Object item)
Test if the item is a boxed primitive.

Parameters:
item -
Returns:
true if it is a boxed primitive
